channel.title: 2 Simple Questions (Please Help)
channel.description:
2 Simple Questions.
1: Everywhere I go its in the "Wild" so everyone can fight everywhere (how may I change that?)
2: Is there any way on how to delete objects that arn't in the.. [code]New Public Void Objects[/code]
(E.g: (Picture)
[IMG]http://i54.tinypic.com/2lcmr9g.jpg[/img]
-Thx Already.
Peace Out ;)

item.title: 2 Simple Questions (Please Help)
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

// All of this is in client.java public boolean isInWilderness(int coordX, int coordY, int Type) { // declaring a boolean called isInWilderness if (Type == 1) { // If the type is set to 1... if ((coordY >= 3523) && (coordY <= 3967) && (coordX <= 3392) // if the type is set to 1 and a player is in these coords... && (coordX >= 2942) || absX >= 3220 && absX <= 3299 // remember to modify these coords at any time you want to work with wilderness areas && absY >= 3520 && absY <= 3548 || absX >= 2250 // remember to modify these coords at any time you want to work with wilderness areas && absX <= 2296 && absY >= 4676 && absY <= 4715 // remember to modify these coords at any time you want to work with wilderness areas || absX >= 3077 && absX <= 3081 && absY >= 3497 // remember to modify these coords at any time you want to work with wilderness areas && absY <= 3500 || absX >= 2528 && absX <= 2533 // remember to modify these coords at any time you want to work with wilderness areas && absY >= 3488 && absY <= 3493) { // remember to modify these coords at any time you want to work with wilderness areas return true; // return the boolean true for that player } // end the condition to check if the person is in those coords } else if (Type == 2) { // if the type is set to 2... if ((coordY >= 3512) && (coordY <= 3967) && (coordX <= 3392) // if the type is set to 2 and a player is in these coords... && (coordX >= 2942)) { return true; // return the boolean true for that player } // end the condition to check if the person is in those coords } // end the condition that checks the type integer return false; // if the type isn't 1 or isn't 2, then return the boolean false } // end the boolean

item.title: 2 Simple Questions (Please Help)
item.dc:creator: @Funny_Man Funny Man
item.description:
@Funny_Man wrote:

Thats Not What I Meant =/…

I Don’t Wanna Make New Wildy Places…

-Every Places I Go Its In The Wildy…-

How Do I Change That So Peoples Cannot Fight Everywhere?

Read full topic

item.title: 2 Simple Questions (Please Help)
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

Change the returning true coordinates to places that need to be in wilderness. Lets say you want X - 1000 and Y - 2000 to be in wildy.

if ((coordX >= 1000) && (coordY <= 2000)) {
return true;

then you can add “or” operators to make more wilderness areas.

Read full topic

item.title: 2 Simple Questions (Please Help)
item.dc:creator: @Funny_Man Funny Man
item.description:
@Funny_Man wrote:

Thx M8 I Found Out How To Erase The Objects Cus Of You…

But I Don’t Get What To Do With The “Boolean isInWilderness”

I Mean I Found It But What I Gotta Change So Its Not Always In The Widly?

Off Topic: That Was A Fast Answer, Lol.

Heres The “Boolean isInWilderness” Code. (Tell Me What I Gotta Change, Please)

[code]}

public boolean isInPvP(int coordX, int coordY, int Type) {
		if ((coordY >= 3490) && (coordY <= 3497) && (coordX <= 2730) && (coordX >= 2721) || (coordY >= 3487) && (coordY <= 3489) && (coordX <= 2727) && (coordX >= 2724)) {		
			return true;
		}
	return false;
}

public boolean isInWilderness(int coordX, int coordY, int Type) {
	if (Type == 1) {
		if ((coordY >= 3838) && (coordY <= 3910) && (coordX <= 2630)
                      && (coordX >= 2584)) {
				
			return true;
		}
	} else if (Type == 2) {
		if ((coordY >= 2585) && (coordY <= 3901) && (coordX <= 2621)
				&& (coordX >= 2942)) {
			return true;
		}
	}
	return false;
}[/code]

Read full topic
